waves.rationale: Foundation wave with no dependencies. US-001 creates SpaceNavigation.svelte, US-004 adds methods to pageStore, US-007 creates API endpoint, US-016 adds optimistic update methods to pageStore. US-004 and US-016 both modify pageStore but add different methods (read vs write) with minimal conflict risk. All other files are distinct.

US-002 creates individual nav button components (new files in nav/ subdirectory). US-006 creates page route loader (contract dependency on US-007 API). US-009, US-012, US-014, US-015 create standalone components with no shared files. All files are distinct, enabling full parallelization.
US-005 modifies PagesNavButton from US-002. US-011 creates PageFilterBar (new file). US-013 creates/extends PageCard (new file). No file conflicts between these three stories.
US-010 creates AllPagesSection which integrates PageFilterBar (US-011), PagesGrid (US-012), and PageCard (US-013). Must wait for these dependencies to complete.
US-008 creates main pages dashboard +page.svelte, integrating RecentlyEditedSection (US-009), AllPagesSection (US-010), and SelectAreaModal (US-014). Must wait for US-010 completion.
US-003 integrates SpaceNavigation (US-001) into SpaceDashboard. Must wait for US-001 completion and US-005 (which modified a nav button component).

Polish and enhancement wave. US-017 updates page creation flows (searches codebase, modifies multiple files but distinct from others). US-018 adds loading states to +page.svelte (may conflict with US-008 changes, but US-008 is complete). US-019 adds accessibility (modifies components from US-008). US-020 adds mobile responsiveness (CSS changes across components). Potential minor conflicts but since these are enhancement layers on completed components, parallelization is reasonably safe with careful merge conflict resolution if needed.

risks: US-004 and US-016 both modify pageStore.svelte.ts - may have merge conflicts if methods touch overlapping code sections
US-018 and US-019 both modify +page.svelte from US-008 - may have merge conflicts in final wave
US-017 searches for 'createPage' across codebase - scope is unclear, may conflict with other stories if page creation logic is in modified files
US-013 'Create or extend' PageCard is ambiguous - if file already exists and was modified by earlier stories, may have conflicts
Wave 7 parallelization assumes enhancement stories can safely layer on completed components - may require sequential execution if conflicts arise
